memories.content: Anchor 0.30.1 fails to compile on Rust 1.92+ due to time crate type inference bug. Use Anchor 0.32.1 for modern Rust toolchains.

avm (Anchor Version Manager) has SSL certificate issues in containerized environments. Direct cargo install from git tag works: cargo install --git https://github.com/coral-xyz/anchor --tag v0.32.1 anchor-cli --locked --force
Solana/Anchor project setup: 1) rustup default stable 2) cargo install anchor-cli from git tag 3) solana-install init 4) anchor build. Skip avm in containers.
GPT-5-mini consultation produced Anchor code targeting 0.30.1 but environment has Rust 1.92. Version mismatch caused 35+ compilation errors.
Repetitive dependency/compile debugging should be delegated to a purpose-built agent that: checks version compatibility, runs cargo check, interprets errors, applies fixes autonomously.
Auto-fixed Anchor version from 0.30.1 to 0.32.1 for Rust 1.92
Agents must gracefully handle missing RAID/external storage. Check path exists before read/write, fall back to local storage, never block on missing mounts.
memories.rationale: RAID is not always plugged in - agents should degrade gracefully not crash

memories.content: Memory Guardian agent handles all storage tier management. Other agents write to ~/unified-memory, guardian syncs to RAID 0. Never write directly to RAID.
All Origin OS agents follow single-responsibility principle. memory-guardian ONLY handles storage sync. build-doctor ONLY handles compilation. No agent does multiple jobs.
memories.rationale: Single-responsibility makes agents debuggable, replaceable, and composable
